title: WorkerLegalAddressChangeEvent
description: An instance to capture an event when a worker legal address changed

items.description: An instance to capture an event when a worker legal address changed

eventID.description: The unique identifier of the event instance. This is set by the system of record once an event is recorded as in progress or complete

serviceCategoryCode.description: The service domain, e.g. HR, Payroll, Benefits, etc. This field is always present and valued based on a standard codelist

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

eventNameCode.description: This is the canonical name of the event, e.g. dependent.add, worker.hire. This field is always present and valued based on a standard codelist

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

eventTitle.description: The event title offers a way to describe a particular instance of an event at a level more granular than the event name, e.g. 2014 Annual Enrollment

eventSubTitle.description: The event sub title provides event instance summary details, e.g. All Annual Enrollment elections become effective on January 1, 2014

eventReasonCode.description: This allows for further refinement of the associated event. For example, for a worker.maritalStatus.change event, the reason code could be used to describe whether it is a Marriage or Divorce. This is optional and valued as defined by the system of record

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

eventStatusCode.description: This identifies the status of the event. An event that has been initiated by the system of record will have an event status code of created. An event that is saved in a work in progress state will have an event status code of inProgress. An event that has been recorded will have an event status code of complete. These values are set by the system of record and valued based on a standard codeslist

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

priorityCode.description: This allows the system of record to prioritize events and is valued based on a standard codelist

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

recordDateTime.description: This is the date time the event is recorded in the system of record with an event status code equal to complete. This value is set by the system of record

creationDateTime.description: This is the date time the event is created. If a system of record creates the event instance, as in the case of an annual enrollment for example, then is sets the creation date time. If a user declares an event, then this is set to the date time when the first call is made to the system of record

effectiveDateTime.description: This is the effective date, or effective date time fo the event from a business perspective. In some systems, this may be referred to as the Event Date. For example, for a birth event, this is the date of birth. If there is no effective date from a business perspective, this is set equal to the record date time

expirationDateTime.description: This value is set by the system of record and used to term the life cycle of an event instance.

dueDateTime.description: This value is set by the system of record and allows for the presentation of a date by which the system of record would like the user to complete the event

originator.description: An originator is a user, machine or event that triggered the event

applicationID.description: The unique identifier of the application which originated the event or a process

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

associateOID.description: The unique identifier of an associate who originated the event.

personOID.description: The unique identifier of a person who originated the event or a process

formattedName.description: Human readable name of the event originator

eventID.description: The unique identifier of the event instance. This is generated once an event is recorded with an event status code equal to Complete. This value is set by the system of record.

eventNameCode.description: This is the canonical name of the event, e.g. dependent.add, worker.hire

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

deviceID.description: The unique identifier of the device, e.g. a time clock, door entry beam

actor.description: The actor is the party that completed the recording of the event

applicationID.description: The unique identifier of the application which originated the event.

formattedName.description: Human readable name of the actor

deviceID.description: The unique identifier of the device, e.g. a time clock, door entry beam.

geoCoordinate.description: The coordinates of the location of the actor

latitude.description: The angle, in degrees, of a position on Earth above the equator. (Latitude is negative for a place below the equator.) specified in decimal degrees

longitude.description: The angle, in degrees, of a position on Earth around the equator from the Greenwich Meridian specified in decimal degrees

deviceUserAgentID.description: Identifier of the user agent of the device used by the actor who worked on the event or process

actAsParty.description: The party (client employee) information that the actor is acting as to complete the recording of the event. Example:  An ADP Support User (principal A = Actor) views data within an ADP Application as a client employee (principal B) in read only mode.

deviceUserAgentID.description: Identifier of the user agent of the device used by the actor who worked on the event or process

organizationOID.description: A unique identifier of a client employee's organization id

onBehalfOfParty.description: The party (client employee) that the actor is acting on behalf of to complete the recording of the event. Example:  An ADP Support User (principal A = Actor) views data within an ADP Application as a client employee (principal B) and can take action on that person's behalf.  The Actor may have access to certain features or screens that the Client Employee cannot view, e.g. diagnostics screens.

items.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links

href.description: The URI of the related entity

rel.description: Indicates the nature of the relationship of the related resource to the resource that generated this representation

title.description: This property defines a title for the link.  The value must be a string. User agents MAY use this title when presenting the link to the user.

targetSchema.description: This property is a schema that defines the expected structure of the JSON representation of the target of the link, if the target of the link is returned using JSON representation.

mediaType.description: The media type that the linked resource will return (Response)

method.description: The HTTP method code (HTTP Verb) traverse the link (GET, POST, PUT or DELETE)

encType.description: If present, this property indicates a query media type format that the server supports for querying or posting to the collection of instances at the target resource.  The query can be suffixed to the target URI to query the collection with property-based constraints on the resources that SHOULD be returned from the server or used to post data to the resource (depending on the method). (Request)

schema.description: This property contains a schema which defines the acceptable structure of the submitted request.  For a GET request, this schema would define the properties for the query string and for a POST request, this would define the body.

eventContext.description: Data which sets the context for the event.  That is, the keys which set context

contextExpressionID.description: A globally unique (GUID) identifier of the context expression. This conveys the context of the associated data. For example, if the context is set to Germany, the data would adhere to the business rules and formatting rules relevant to Germany

associateOID.description: A unique identifier of a covered individual when there is an AOID

transform.description: Data which is transformed as a result of the event

eventReasonCode.description: This allows for further refinement of the associated event. For example, for a worker.maritalStatus.change event, the reason code could be used to describe whether it is a Marriage vs. Divorce vs. Separation

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

eventStatusCode.description: This identifies the status of the event. An event that has been created, either by the system of record or as the result of a user, will have an event status code of Created. An event that is saved in a work in progress state (as determined by the permissable state codes), will have an event status code of InProgress. An event that has been recorded, will have an event status code of Complete. This value is set by the system of record

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

effectiveDateTime.description: This is the effective date, or effective date time fo the event from a business perspective. In some systems, this may be referred to as the Event Date. For example, for a birth event, this is the date of birth. If there is no effective date from a business perspective, this is set equal to the record date time

legalAddress.description: This is the primary residential address that  is used by an organization for payroll, taxation, and benefit program eligibility

nameCode.description: A descriptive coded name of the address

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

scriptCode.description: The type of script the in which the associated entity is represented. Associated codelist is ISO15924-A. Use the alpha-4 representation versus the single digit numeric representation. Format is lowercase with initial letter capitalized. For example, Cyrillic is Cyrl

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

lineTwo.description: Line Two of Street Address Information

lineThree.description: Line Three of Street Address Information

lineFour.description: Line Four of Street Address Information

lineFive.description: Line Five of Street Address Information

buildingNumber.description: The number of a building in the context of a physical address, e.g. House Number

buildingName.description: The name of a building in the context of a physical address, e.g. Rockefeller Center

streetTypeCode.description: The type of street, e.g. Lane, Passage, Way

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

unit.description: A unit in the context of an address, e.g. an Apartment Number or an Office

floor.description: A floor in the context of an address

stairCase.description: A reference to a particular staircase in the context of an address

door.description: A reference to a particular door in the context of an address. e.g. Apartment Number

deliveryPoint.description: A way to identify a specific delivery location, e.g. a mail-stop

plotID.description: A way to identify a building plot, e.g. a specific building construction site

cityName.description: A city in the context of an address

countrySubdivisionLevel1.description: A country subdivision correlating to a administrative level one level below country. For example, in the United States, this would be a state

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

subdivisionType.description: The type of a country sub-division, e.g. state, county

countrySubdivisionLevel2.description: A country subdivision correlating to a administrative level two levels below country. For example, in the United States, this might be a county

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

subdivisionType.description: The type of a country sub-division, e.g. state, county

countryCode.description: A simple (string) code.  Can have a code list reference

postalCode.description: The string of characters used to identify the postal code

geoCoordinate.description: The coordinates of the location of the address

latitude.description: The angle, in degrees, of a position on Earth above the equator. (Latitude is negative for a place below the equator.) specified in decimal degrees

longitude.description: The angle, in degrees, of a position on Earth around the equator from the Greenwich Meridian specified in decimal degrees

sameAsAddressIndicator.description: This indicator is used to support the ability to say that one address is the same as another. For example, the address of a dependent is the same as that of a worker. If a given system supports this functionality, this field should be present and set to true. The meta component associated to an event that allows for the adding or changing of an address, should use the links array associated to the indicator to define the list of addresses from which the user can select to set the address in context to be the same as.

sameAsAddressLink.description: This link is used in conjunction with the sameAsAddressIndicator. If a given system support same as address functionality, this link will point to the address that a user has selected as being the same as the one in context. For example, if the address in context is a dependent address, and the user has indicated that the dependent address is the same as the legal address of the worker, this link would point to worker/id/person/legalAddress.

For example, the address of a dependent is the same as that of a worker. If a given system supports this functionality, this field should be present and set to true. sameAsAddressLink.description: This link is used in conjunction with the sameAsAddressIndicator. processMessages.description: processMessage is optional and contains processing information for either the request (at the ConfirmMessage level) or a resource being managed in the request (at the ResourceMessage level).  Most often there will be a single instance for an associated request or resource, but this structure allows for more than one if needed, for example, if multiple errors exist for a single resource.

resourceMessages.description: resource Message contains the resource-specific processing results for resources being managed in the request.  A resource may have its processing reported as:  succeeded or failed.  It must be used to represent resource-specific messages.  In the case of a request managing multiple resources and resource-specific messages are to be returned, then this array will contain one object for each such resource of the request.

items.title: ProcessMessageWithResourceStatusCode
items.description: Each object contains processing information for either the request (at the ConfirmMessage level) or a resource being managed in the request (at the ResourceMessage level).

processMessageID.description: An identifier for the instance of the process message.

schemeAgencyName.description: The agency that issues the ID

messageTypeCode.description: Process Message instances may be of type: success, warning, error, or info.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

sourceLocationExpression.description: Expression that provides the location (or source) of content in a message instance that is associated with a process message. Examples of expression languages include: XPath, XQuery, JSON Pointer.

expressionLanguageCode.description: Identifies the language used for expressions communicated in this message.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code

longName.description: Long description of the related code

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

links.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links.

items.description: A link description object is used to describe link relations.  In the context of a schema, it defines the link relations of the instances of the schema, and can be parameterized by the instance values.  The link description format can be used on its own in regular (non-schema documents), and use of this format can be declared by referencing the normative link description schema as the the schema for the data structure that uses the links

href.description: The URI of the related entity

rel.description: Indicates the nature of the relationship of the related resource to the resource that generated this representation

title.description: This property defines a title for the link.  The value must be a string. User agents MAY use this title when presenting the link to the user.

targetSchema.description: This property is a schema that defines the expected structure of the JSON representation of the target of the link, if the target of the link is returned using JSON representation.

mediaType.description: The media type that the linked resource will return (Response)

method.description: The HTTP method code (HTTP Verb) traverse the link (GET, POST, PUT or DELETE)

encType.description: If present, this property indicates a query media type format that the server supports for querying or posting to the collection of instances at the target resource.  The query can be suffixed to the target URI to query the collection with property-based constraints on the resources that SHOULD be returned from the server or used to post data to the resource (depending on the method). (Request)

schema.description: This property contains a schema which defines the acceptable structure of the submitted request.  For a GET request, this schema would define the properties for the query string and for a POST request, this would define the body.

codeValue.description: The code associated with the message description.

messageTxt.description: The value/content of the message description.

resourceStatusCode.description: DEPRECATED - Use messageTypeCode instead. The processing results status code of the resource of the request.

codeValue.description: The code for the related entity.

shortName.description: Short description of the related code not to exceed 25 characters

longName.description: Long description of the related code
